newsitem.title: INDIA: India's NIIT to partner Oracle.
newsitem.headline: India's NIIT to partner Oracle.

text.p: Oracle Software India Ltd, a subsidiary of U.S' Oracle Corp, will launch this week a business partnership with the Indian computer education company, NIIT Ltd, an Oracle official said on Monday.
Oracle India is scheduled to announce a business partnership with NIIT on Tuesday at a press conference in New Delhi, Purnima Sahni Mohanty, an Oracle India spokeswoman, told Reuters.
Oracle India is a 100 percent subsidiary of Oracle corp, which is the world's second largest computer software company.

In 1993, Oracle set up a wholly-owned subsidiary in India after the country opened up its economy under a reform programme launched in 1991. It uses Indian software engineers to develop its programmes.
NIIT is India's market leader in computer training and has subsidiaries in 12 countries including the United States, Britain, Sweden, France, Germany, Japan and Singapore.
NIIT announced last week that annual revenue from its multimedia development business had surpassed its revenue from computer training courses.
